Description: East Greek terracotta figure or figure vase (plastic vase) in the form of a seated kore (Greek maiden) or seated goddess. Fragment of fore legs only. She sits on a throne with a footstool, hands on knees. She wears a chiton and symmetrical himation, hanging in folds from the knees. The modelling is sketchy. Light brown clay with grey core and abundant silver mica inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ5 (top level of 'bothros' / 'trench with bowls') or AΠ8 (above the bothros' and central area)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

There are similar plastic vessel kore heads from Naukratis (GR1886, 0401.1400, 1421) also in similar micaceous orange fabric and dated to the late 6th century BC (Higgins 1954, no.61). There is a close parallel from Lindos, Rhodes, dated 525BC-400BC (Blinkenberg 1931, pl. 85, no. 2115). Parallels from Kamirus, Rhodes, dated to the late 6th century BC (Higgins 1970, nos 68-74; GR 1863,0330.20 dated c. 540BC - 520BC). These were originally thought to be made in Rhodes (Higgins 1954, 48-9), but instead is probably Milesian as Jones' NAA analysis of GR1888,0601.659 also from Naukratis, places it within his East Greek, probably Milesian group (Jones 1985, 673). Higgins cites parallels from Cumae, Selinus, Lindos, Ialysus and Thera (Maximova 1927, no. 68; Blinkenberg 1931, pl. 95, no. 2117, see also pl. 96, no. 2129; Higgins 1954, 50). An East Greek kore flask parallel from Clazomenae is dated to the mid 6th century BC (Ersoy 2007, pl. 19.2) . A close parallel was found at the Turkish site of Erythrae and was dated to the end of the 6th century BC (Bayburtluoğlu 1977, pl.19, no.31). Bayburtluoğlu, C. 1977. Erythrai II. Ankara. Blinkenberg, C. 1931. ‘Lindos, Fouilles del'Acropole, 1902-14: Les Petits Objects’. Ersoy, Y. 2007. Notes on History and Archaeology of early Clazomenae, in Cobet, J. (ed.) Frühes Ionien: eine Bestandsaufnahme; Panionion-Symposion Güzelçamlı, 26 September-1 Oktober 1999. Deutsches Archäologisches Institut. Milesische Forschungen; Band 5. Mainz am Rhein: Von Zabern. pp 149-78. Jones, R. E. 1985. ‘Greek and Cypriot Pottery: A Review of Scientific Studies’. Athens. Maximova, M. I. 1927. ‘Les vases plastiques dans l’antiquité’. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.037) (Phase 3)
